list_definition.definition: to disconnect from the electricity supply
to take the plug out of.

list_ex_of_english: An example of a crash-only implementation is unplugging a computer and plugging it back in.
There was no reminder for viewers to switch off, and unplug, their television sets.
She tries to unplug it and shocks herself.
She tells him to unplug it and get out.

With virtualization, a system administrator could combine several physical systems into virtual machines on one single, powerful system, thereby unplugging the original hardware and reducing power and cooling consumption.
When another soldier tries to unplug the jukebox, the entire place erupts into a fight.
He unplugs it from the wall, but it still rings.
When the power cord stretches enough to unplug the jackhammer, the coyote climbs out and finds himself vibrating sporadically.
